bioghist.p: Miguel Romera-Navarro (1888-1954) was a university professor and scholar of Spanish language literature. Born in Spain, he received his bachelor's degree from the University of Madrid, and his master's and doctoral degrees from the University of Pennsylvania. He joined the faculty of Penn in 1916 (becoming a full professor in 1927) and remained there until 1947. He then took a position as chair of Spanish at the University of Texas, where he remained until his death. He wrote many books and articles, and was active in the founding of the Hispanic Review.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photostatic reproductions of manuscripts by Lope Felix de Vega Carpio, Calderon de la Barca, and Francisco Gomez Quevedo y Villegas. The copies were made from originals held by the Biblioteca Nacional (Madrid) and the British Museum.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
